Short answer: Yes. In Zoom, a red slash through the microphone icon means your mic is muted.

How to unmute:
- Desktop (Windows/Mac):
  - Click the microphone button (Mute/Unmute) in the meeting controls.
  - Keyboard shortcut: Alt + A (Windows) or Command + Shift + A (Mac).
  - Temporarily unmute: Hold Spacebar to talk (if the host enabled push-to-talk).
- Mobile (iOS/Android):
  - Tap the screen to show controls, then tap the microphone icon to toggle mute.
- Dial-in by phone: Press *6 to mute/unmute.

If you can’t unmute:
- You may be host-muted: If you see “You are muted by the host,” you cannot unmute until the host allows it. Use “Raise Hand” or chat to request unmute.
- Check your input device:
  - Click the arrow next to the mic icon > Select the correct microphone > Test mic.
  - Make sure your headset’s inline mute switch (if any) is off.
- Check OS/app permissions:
  - Windows: Settings > Privacy & Security > Microphone > Allow apps to access the microphone > Ensure Zoom is allowed.
  - Mac: System Settings > Privacy & Security > Microphone > Enable Zoom.
  - iOS: Settings > Zoom > Microphone > On.
  - Android: Settings > Apps > Zoom > Permissions > Microphone > Allow.
- If using the web client:
  - Allow microphone access in the browser (click the padlock/camera icon near the address bar and allow mic access), then refresh.

Audio troubleshooting in Zoom:
- Zoom app > Settings > Audio > Test Mic and Speaker. Speak and check the input level.
- Disable other apps that may be using the mic (Teams, Discord, DAWs) and close extra audio devices.
- Restart Zoom or your computer if the mic isn’t detected.

Tip: The red slash only indicates Zoom mute; your mic could also be muted at the system or device level. Ensure both are unmuted.
